description.plain:
Jackson Wang is a Hong Kong rapper, singer, and dancer. He is a member of the South Korean boy group GOT7 formerly under JYP Entertainment. He is currently active under his own label “Team Wang” in China as a solo artist and TV host and has partnerships with Sublime Entertainment in South Korea, and 88rising globally.

In China, he has been a mentor on the show Idol Producer as a rap mentor where he guided trainees in pursuit of debut.

As a solo artist, Jackson has released stand alone singles including his 2017 hit “Papillon.”. He has appeared on various soundtracks and as a featured artist including on South Korean singer, SUNMI’s 2014 track, “Frozen in Time.”

Jackson speaks fluent English, Cantonese, Mandarin, Shanghainese, Japanese, and Korean, with some French.

body.plain:
Jackson Wang is a Hong Kong rapper, singer, and dancer. He is a member of the South Korean boy group GOT7 formerly under JYP Entertainment. He is currently active under his own label “Team Wang” in China as a solo artist and TV host and has partnerships with Sublime Entertainment in South Korea, and 88rising globally.

In China, he has been a mentor on the show Idol Producer as a rap mentor where he guided trainees in pursuit of debut.

As a solo artist, Jackson has released stand alone singles including his 2017 hit “Papillon.”. He has appeared on various soundtracks and as a featured artist including on South Korean singer, SUNMI’s 2014 track, “Frozen in Time.”

Jackson speaks fluent English, Cantonese, Mandarin, Shanghainese, Japanese, and Korean, with some French.

songs.full_title: Papillon (巴比龍) by Jackson Wang (王嘉爾)
songs.title: Papillon (巴比龍)

description.plain:
“Papillon” is Jackson Wang’s solo debut single, released on August 26, 2017. Upon release, the track ranked #1 and swept all major Chinese charts including QQ Music, V Weekly Music Chart, and YinYueTai MV Chart.

Jackson based his song off a character of a movie with the same title, ‘Papillon’. In this song, he talks about the feeling of freedom and success after establishing his own studio in China ‘Wang Jiaer Studio’ hence the constant reference of Team Wang.

body.plain:
“Papillon” is Jackson Wang’s solo debut single, released on August 26, 2017. Upon release, the track ranked #1 and swept all major Chinese charts including QQ Music, V Weekly Music Chart, and YinYueTai MV Chart.

Jackson based his song off a character of a movie with the same title, ‘Papillon’. In this song, he talks about the feeling of freedom and success after establishing his own studio in China ‘Wang Jiaer Studio’ hence the constant reference of Team Wang.

songs.title: Okay

description.plain:
This song is a prequel of Jackson’s “Papillon”, as shown through the Music Video and lyrics alike. In the end of the MV of “Okay”, Jackson got into the same helicopter that he is shown leaving at the beginning of the “Papillon” Music Video.

The lyrics are open and straightforward. Jackson is telling us about his feelings after a breakup: he still has feelings for his partner, but because they have left Jackson, and Jackson is left to deal with his emotions alone. The whole song is Jackson trying to convince himself that he is “Okay”.

The lyrics are open and straightforward. Jackson is telling us about his feelings after a breakup: he still has feelings for his partner, but because they have left Jackson, and Jackson is left to deal with his emotions alone. The whole song is Jackson trying to convince himself that he is “Okay”.

songs.title: 100 Ways

description.plain: In “100 Ways,” Jackson explores the concept of forbidden love. It also explores the themes of not being able to control time and love. Quickly after the song’s release, the music video’s choreography began trending on TikTok.

songs.embed_content: Read “100 Ways” by Jackson Wang (王嘉爾) on Genius
